title: Hana Cross pictured with new flame after run-in with Brooklyn Beckham
text:
Hana Cross holds hands with new flame (Picture: MEGA)

Brooklyn Beckham’s ex Hana Cross was spotted holding hands with her new flame on Nasser Alfallah, on Friday night.

Despite attending Paris Hilton’s Halloween bash earlier on in the week, it seems the loved up duo were up for a second round of spooky shenanigans.

Heading to yet another party, the 22-year-old was all dressed up in a black bralette and matching jeans, with a denim jacket thrown over her shoulders.

While her man was also wearing all black, with a white bandana tied around his knee.

It seems he was taking inspo from Brooklyn, who showed up to the same party as them the other night with a red bandana wrapped around his face.

They looked loved up as they went to another Halloween party (Picture: MEGA)

Yes, the budding photographer also attended Paris’ star-studded event and arrived just moments after Hana.

Earlier this year the duo decided to go their separate ways after just nine months of dating.

And the 20-year-old’s famous parents were said to be delighted by the news of their split.

‘Brooklyn and Hana have called off their romance for good,’ a source told The Sun.

Hana recently split from Brooklyn Beckham (Picture: WireImage)

The insider added: ‘David and Victoria very glad and relieved and are backing him 100 per cent.’

Reports of their breakup surfaced back in August, as they’d last been seen together in July and went on separate holidays.

However, it appears they have both moved on as Brooklyn is now rumoured to be dating model Phoebe Torrance.

According to the Mirror, the pair have been ‘seeing each other’ for the last few months.

The publication went onto claim that they were ‘glued to each other’s side all night’ at the launch party for The Wellington Restaurant and Club last month.

Brooklyn previously dated Chloe Grace Moretz for four years, on and off, but the couple parted ways in April 2018 after he was spotted kissing Playboy model Lexi Wood in New York.
